revised_title: Sherrington's Contributions to Neurophysiology: A Historical Appraisal
tldr: This article provides a historical appraisal of Sir Charles Sherrington's contributions to the field of neurophysiology. It highlights his development of the neurone theory, his work on synapses, and his pioneering research on reflexes and the central nervous system. Sherrington's concepts, such as the principle of convergence, the final common path, and reciprocal innervation, have had a lasting impact on the understanding of the nervous system.
